properties.areaDesc: Greater Portland Metro Area; Greater Vancouver Area; Central Willamette Valley; South  Willamette Valley
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 8:15AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
Periods of snow showers, mixed with some rain at the lowest
elevations, will continue to move across much of the Greater
Portland and Vancouver metro areas through late this morning. in
areas where snow showers are heaviest and most persistent, light
snow accumulations are possible on any elevated or exposed road
surfaces. Slow down and use extra caution on bridges, ramps,
overpasses and other elevated road surfaces this morning that
could be locally slick and hazardous.

Farther south in the Willamette Valley, local areas of clearing
have allowed temperatures to drop to slightly below freezing,
which has resulted in slick spots on elevated road surfaces such
and bridges, ramps and overpasses. Temperatures should rise to
above freezing in most areas by around 10 AM.

Allow plenty of extra travel time this morning, and slow down, and
allow for extra following distance between vehicles as roads may
be icy; especially on secondary roads and overpasses in outlying
areas. For current road conditions in Oregon, check tripcheck.com,
and wsdot.com for Washington road conditions.

NWSheadline: SNOW SHOWERS AND NEAR-FREEZING TEMPERATURES CAUSING SOME SLIPPERY AREAS ON ROADS THROUGH LATE THIS MORNING
